thread.title: Donating Unused Food Is Good, Can Be Even Better

author: wsjcom
title: Donating Unused Food Is Good, Can Be Even Better
text: It is a financial mistake to let unsold food go to waste (“Food-Waste Query on Amazon’s Plate,” Business News, March 2). Although many companies discard perishables on or before the “best by” date, those goods may still be fit for human consumption for several more days. Discarding them yields a federal income-tax deduction in the amount of the cost. But if that food is donated to a 501(C) (3) charitable organization to feed the hungry, the tax deduction is much higher—the retail selling price. Regarding potential legal liability, many states have “good Samaritan laws” that protect donors from liability in these circumstances....
